next_steps.note: Write a single, short poem (8-12 lines) as a starting point, focusing on one of the brainstormed themes. Add to 'Progress' as 'First Draft - [Theme]'.
Research and identify 2-3 poets whose style resonates with your intended direction. Document in 'Ideas' as 'Inspirational Poets'.
Define the desired overall 'tone' or 'mood' for the poetry (e.g., melancholic, hopeful, satirical). Add to 'Ideas'.
Establish a basic structure or format for tracking poem drafts (e.g., a simple file naming convention or a dedicated section in the project board). Document this in 'Ideas'.
Brainstorm potential themes or subjects for the poetry (addressing 'Ideas' being empty).
Draft a short poem (5-10 lines) as a starting point, even if it's rough (starting 'Progress').
Research and select 2-3 poets whose style resonates with your vision for the project (addressing potential stylistic issues).
Define the overall scope of the project - will this be a collection, a single long-form poem, or something else? (clarifying '4 next steps pending').
Identify a feedback mechanism - who will review drafts and provide constructive criticism? (addressing potential issues and moving toward completion)
Brainstorm 3 distinct poetic forms to explore for this project (e.g., sonnet, haiku, free verse). Document in 'Ideas' list.
Identify a core theme or subject matter for the poetry. Add to 'Ideas' list with 2-3 potential options.
Draft a short, initial poem (at least 8 lines) based on one of the ideas generated. Add to 'Progress' as 'First Draft'.
Review 'Ideas' list and prioritize the 9 pending next steps, categorizing them as 'Research', 'Writing', or 'Revision'.
Define criteria for successful completion of the project (e.g., number of poems, specific form achieved, theme exploration). Document in 'Issues' as a clarification point.
Error streaming ideas response: 'run_manager'
Brainstorm 3-5 specific poetry themes or prompts to focus initial writing on, given the 'run_manager' error suggests a need for focused input.
Document the 'run_manager' error in detail (exact message, context) for troubleshooting; research potential causes and solutions online or with relevant resources.
Draft a short (e.g., 10-line) poem based on one of the brainstormed themes to establish a baseline and identify any immediate creative roadblocks.
Review existing poetry resources (books, online collections, workshops) for inspiration and techniques relevant to the chosen themes.
Prioritize the 15 pending next steps based on feasibility and impact; break down the top 3 into smaller, more manageable tasks.
